skill.name: foundations-market-intelligence
skill.description: Market analysis and competitive intelligence for startups. Use when analyzing market opportunities, sizing TAM, profiling segments, or mapping competition.
skill.summary: Market analysis and competitive intelligence for startups. Use when analyzing market opportunities, ...
skill.author: BellaBe

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing markdown frameworks for market intelligence. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access. All 57 static findings are false positives from business terminology being misidentified as security patterns (e.g., 'SAM' acronym misclassified as Windows SAM database).

content.value_statement: Startups often struggle to validate market opportunities with data-backed insights. This skill provides structured frameworks for TAM/SAM/SOM analysis, competitive mapping, and customer profiling to inform go/no-go decisions.
actual_capabilities: Calculate TAM, SAM, and SOM using top-down, bottom-up, and value theory methods
Map competitive landscape including direct, indirect, and future threats
Profile target customer segments with demographics, psychographics, and behavioral data
Assess market timing, growth trends, and disruption signals
Score market opportunities with weighted criteria for go/no-go recommendations
Generate structured output templates for market intelligence reports
limitations: Does not access real-time market data or industry reports automatically
Cannot verify competitor funding or latest company information without external research
Outputs depend on user-provided inputs and assumptions
Cannot conduct primary research such as customer interviews

use_cases.title: Validate Market Entry
use_cases.description: Analyze a new market before committing resources to validate opportunity size and competitive threats.

use_cases.title: Segment Target Customers
use_cases.description: Profile ideal customer profiles and personas to inform product roadmap and messaging decisions.

use_cases.title: Quarterly Market Refresh
use_cases.description: Update competitive analysis and market sizing to inform quarterly planning and strategic positioning.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Market Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the market for [product_idea] targeting [target_geography] in the [industry_vertical] sector. Calculate TAM, SAM, and SOM. Identify the top 3 customer segments.

prompt_templates.title: Competitive Mapping
prompt_templates.prompt: Map the competitive landscape for [product_idea]. Include direct competitors, indirect competitors, and potential future threats. Identify key differentiation opportunities.

prompt_templates.title: Customer Intelligence
prompt_templates.prompt: Create detailed customer profiles for [product_idea]. Define the ideal customer profile including firmographics, demographics, and buying behavior. Build 2-3 primary personas.

prompt_templates.title: Opportunity Scoring
prompt_templates.prompt: Score the market opportunity for [product_idea] using weighted criteria: market attractiveness, competitive position, and execution fit. Provide a go/no-go recommendation with confidence level and next actions.

output_examples.input: Analyze the market for AI-powered personal finance coaching for Gen Z in the United States
output: Top Segment: 18-27 year old digitally native users - high urgency, willing to pay $15-25/month
Key Competitors: Mint, YNAB, Betterment - strengths in budgeting tools, gaps in AI coaching
Market Timing: Score 72/100 - Go with caveats on willingness-to-pay validation
Recommended Next Actions: 1) Conduct 20 customer interviews 2) Build competitive feature matrix 3) Run landing page test

output_examples.input: Should we pivot from B2C fitness app to B2B corporate wellness SaaS?
output: B2B Market: TAM $12B growing 15% annually, SAM $3.2B, SOM $45M (Year 1-3)
B2C Market: TAM $8B, more saturated with established players
Strategic Fit: Team has direct sales experience, B2B requires longer sales cycles
Recommendation: INVESTIGATE FURTHER - B2B offers larger long-term opportunity but requires 2x GTM investment
Next Actions: 1) Interview 10 HR decision-makers 2) Validate pricing with pilot 3) Assess regulatory requirements

best_practices: Always validate market size estimates using multiple methods (top-down AND bottom-up)
Focus competitive analysis on the top 5 most relevant competitors to maintain focus
Document every assumption with sources to enable future validation and updates
anti_patterns: Using TAM as if it is achievable without applying serviceability constraints
Analyzing too many competitors which dilutes insights and wastes time
Asking customers if they would buy something instead of observing behavior

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It is compatible with any LLM that follows system instructions.

faq.question: How accurate are the market size estimates?
faq.answer: Accuracy depends on input quality and assumptions. Cross-validate multiple methods and update quarterly for best results.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with my CRM or data sources?
faq.answer: This skill does not access external systems. Provide your own data as input for customized analysis.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill runs entirely within your AI conversation. No data is sent to external services or stored anywhere.

faq.question: Why does my market sizing differ from industry reports?
faq.answer: Differences are expected. This skill uses bottom-up calculations which often differ from top-down industry estimates. Both approaches are valuable.

faq.question: How does this compare to hiring a market research firm?
faq.answer: This skill provides faster, cost-effective initial analysis. For definitive numbers, combine AI insights with primary research and industry reports.
